values:
Resting heart rate:  98. 

Once again my obtuse agoraphobic sense has hit me, though the feeling is a little weaker than I will allow myself to believe. 

I'm terrified of leaving my house for reasons not entirely known to me at the moment. 

It's four in the morning and I can't sleep.  I've tried to lie down and force myself to sleep, but every time I close my eyes I can see my pulse thumping fast and hard against the lids of my eyes.  Don't worry - I'm not trying to be poetic here - anxiety is anything but poetic most of the time.   

On the subject of poetry, I have to admit that I doubt I could write a good piece of it, even (and especially) if I tried.  Now that we've cleared that up ... 

Resting heart rate:  77. 

Perhaps if I focus everything I've got on this, my pulse will slow.  Maybe if I could just remember that all is right I wouldn't feel so overwrought at the trifles that only exist at four in the morning.  What would be a useful expedient for sleep?  I wonder if I ask too many questions. 

Think poetry...  Think long, mundane, wildlife poetry.  Perhaps something written about birds.... 

Resting heart rate:  71. 

That feels much better.

I am absolutely bewildered at the way that sugar substitutes never seem to completely dissolve in iced beverages.  You end up sucking bland coffee through a straw one minute and a hefty mouthful of much-too-sweetness the next.  It's nothing short of a perplexity.

A woman sitting at a near-distant table had her tea served to her a few moments ago.  A smile on her face, the cup set in front of her, then she claps, following her applause with a meek "Yay!"  Perhaps we shouldn't give something as insignificant as a cup of hot tea an audible ovation?  Perhaps I should tell her that there is something outright creepy about a forty-something-year-old woman clapping at her tea?  I'd offer her a popsicle if I had one.

I feel vulnerable and a little paranoid being out after dark without wearing bug spray.  West Nile and all.  I kinda feel ballsy, like I'm living on the edge.  I'm also beginning to feel a little pathetic about the whole thing - that I even worry about such things.

You know you're from way out-of-town when you describe your tattoos as being written in "Greek" and the guy you're talking to thinks you said "Green."  You also know you're from way out-of-town when the girl standing next to him asks if you're a teacher because you know Greek.  I didn't feel it appropriate to go into the problems surrounding international language barriers.

I have been seriously considering moving to Africa to do mission work.  I figure I've spread my smug wit more than enough around here.  Why not grace another country with my cheery, sun-shiny disposition, right?

Nothing more runs through my head at the moment.

Talk about beating a once-innocent LJ post to a pulp.  Jeez.

Hey fuckers!  At long last, I've decided to come back to LiveJournal just to harass all of you.

MUAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!

My daily zen came from nothing more than talking to my best friend in New Orleans for two hours, deciding that breasts are indeed strange, and realizing while looking over my credit card statement that I have a bizarre obsession with stripper shoes. If only I would have found the ambition to purchase a deadly weapon, I'd say this was one of my better days. I would elaborate on all of that, but somehow I don't think I have to.
If you woke up and I was in bed with you, what would be your first thought?

So, I've learned a great deal of completely meaningless information about myself today: 1. Thanks to the University of Cambridge, I could move to London if I really wanted to endure the torture that is the UK. 2. Making a promise not to ever ingest anything parasitic is a virtual impossibility. 3. I can make Aussie Chicken without setting myself on fire. 4. Bush really stresses me out (and not that kind of bush, you fucking perverts). and lastly, 5. Ninjas, though stealthy and a tad bit annoying, always drink for free. .... Don't worry... None of it made any sense to me either.

I thought it would be a good idea to throw a Valentine's Day party.

I was wrong.

I realized the consequence of my decision shortly after midnight when, from my bathroom, I hear a group of people moaning, pounding, and breaking things.

As people began to wake up this morning, I made it very clear to all of them that I wouldn't step foot in my bathroom until someone cleaned the floor, which appeared to blotched with mystery spots.

At this late hour, I still haven't been able to use my damn bathroom.

Un relatedly, I've managed to hit an all time low in healthy decision making:

I put twenty-four sugar packets into my Starbucks coffee this afternoon.  And I drank the whole damn thing.

If I happen to develop a terrible case of diabetes and drop dead atop a thirty-pound pile of sugar, just know that I hated you all.

Seer

The ULTIMATE personality test
brought to you by Quizilla Why the hell do I always get roped into taking these damn quizzes?

In the past twenty-four hours, I've collectively spent fifteen of said hours doing a 2000 piece puzzle.

Damn it feels good to be a gangsta.

My brother and I spent the greater part of the afternoon trying to finish production on his musical project. If I hear his two songs once more, I'm going to hack my head off. Audio coming soon thanks to .
My brother and I:

My brother got into town yesterday.

We got drunk and blew up sticks of dynamite that he purchased from some road-side fireworks vendor in New Mexico.

The police were called at three in the morning, but we fled the scene.  

It was marvelous.

You know what will really fuck up your day?

Your mom comparing sex to Thanksgiving dinner.

Just try and get anything done after that.

Redemption:  I got a Black Lab today.

I shall name him Poe, and he shall be mine, and he shall be my Poe.

Due to some uncontrollable circumstances, I am distracted and unable to write..... And we all know that writers' block makes me a little homicidal. So I'm taking a break and taking back my quiz from , which was originally inspired by You wanna hear it? Here it goes.... {name} Aspen {born} 01/23/1980 {born in} Biloxi, MS {resides in} Denver, CO {eyes} blue {hair} blonde {height} 5'9" {shoe size} who the hell came up with this question? LAST TIME YOU... {had a nightmare} it's been a while {ate} few hours ago {exercised} snowboarding on my b-day {dyed your hair} few months ago {brushed your hair} braids require no brushing {washed your hair} three days ago {checked your e-mail} an hour ago {cried} can't remember. It's been a while {slept} Last night {called someone} about an hour ago {went to the mall} the other day {giggled} I don't giggle {smiled} today {laughed} today DO YOU... {smoke} Absolutely {do drugs} not anymore {drink} who doesn't? {cheat} I have in the past {have sex} even when I'm tired. {sleep with stuffed animals} not since I was twelve {have a boyfriend/girlfriend} Uh, a little more than that. {have a dream that keeps coming back} yeah, but it's all good shit {play an instrument} piano - all the time {believe there is life on other planets} from what I've seen on this fucking planet, I certainly hope life exists on others. {remember your first love} yes, and we're still in love with each other. {read the newspaper} every damn day, and quite frankly it's getting a little depressing {consider love a mistake} only if you fall in love with someone who should be killed {like the taste of alcohol} depends on the time of day {pray} all the fucking time, and He wants me to leave Him alone. {go to church} Haven't been in about a month {have any pets} my dog and sometimes my brother, when he's in town {wear hats} Rarely {have an obsession} writing, writing, writing, writing, writing, writing, writing..... {have a secret crush} Well if I told you, it wouldn't be a secret, now would it? {collect anything} not consciously {like your handwriting} sure, but thanks to technology and transcribers, I rarely have to use it {have any bad habits} I'm certain I do {believe in witches} no {believe in ghosts} only on Tuesdays and bank holidays {steal} I stole once, when I was eight. CURRENT... {dress} jeans, white t-shirt, no bra {mood} pretty fucking mellow {music} Sneaker Pimps {taste} Fat Tire {hair} wherever it wants to go {annoyance} none {smell} cigarettes and my perfume {book} The Torture Garden {fingernail color} black {refreshment} Fat Tire {worry} I don't worry about much these days {favorite celebrity} That one guy that I wanna fuck {date} February 2, 2005 LAST PERSON... {you talked to} Aaron {you hugged} Aaron {you instant messaged} I haven't IM'd in years {you yelled at} I don't put myself in the position to yell these days, but if I had to answer I would have to say that Vegas guy {who broke your heart} my brother, when he moved back to Arizona {you kissed} Aaron, and I'm still melting all over the place {looked at} Aaron (Try and quell your surprise) {you called} Gilana FAVORITE... {movie} movies are only good to fuck to {color} black {cd} how the hell does one go about answering that question? {candy} baklava. It's not exactly candy to us, but to the Jews? Well, I'm not going into that. {animal} my dog when he decides to shut the fuck up {tv show} I don't watch enough TV to accurately answer this question {ice cream} I haven't eaten ice cream since my son's sixth birthday party almost a year ago {radio station} radio kills {computer game} I only use this thing to write, fuckers {cartoon} whatever Draven's into at the time. That was fucking exhausting. Back to it.

Oh the joy that is laughing at someone else's expense. This afternoon after audio production, on my way out of the UCD studio, I had the pleasure of seeing a girl, completely decked out in designer everything, eat pavement after getting the heel of her boot stuck in a crack in the sidewalk. She got up, looked around nervously, and put on her *I'm totally sexy* smile for a group of guys who saw the whole thing. ME: Are you okay? (Trying to keep from laughing) HER: Yeah, I didn't fall. (Looking at me like I'm the dumb ass) ME: Uh huh..... HER: I DIDN'T! I was just trying to pick up my pen. ME: Looked to me like you were trying to break your ankle. There was a long pause. Finally, she says, "Oh I get it!" and laughs a little more than she needed to to convince me, then walks away. I just.... *shaking my head*... I just can't think of anything else to say to that.

I lie awake, I've gone to ground I'm watching porn, in my hotel dressing gown And now I dream of you, But I still believe, there's only enough for one, in this lonely hotel suite The journey's long, and I feel so bad I'm thinking back, to the last day we had Old moon fades into the new, and soon I know I'll be back with you I'm nearly with you On a clear day, I'll fly home to you I'm bending time, getting back to you But old moon fades into the new, and soon I'll be back with you I'm nearly with you.... Goddamn you, fleeting emotion.

At Jerusalem Restaurant this evening while waiting in line for my order: GUY: Did you get any of the baklava? It's delicious. ME: Yeah, I've eaten nothing but the bakalva for two days now. GUY: I make a trip all the way from Loveland to get the stuff. ME: *smiles* GUY: I like big sacks. ME: ......? GUY: I always have to tell them to put it in a bigger bag so it doesn't drip all over the car on the way home. ME: ...OH! You were talking about carrying bags. Okay.

I went to Bebe today.

While a woman was paying for her scarf, the idiot she was with picked up a blue thong and asked me what it was.

ME:  "It's a thong. [You weird-ass motherfucker.]"

IDIOT: "Ooooooh, yeah! It's cool now to have your underwear showing." 

Then he literally puffed up with pride and announced, "'Course, I don't wear underwear."

?!?!?!?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

WELL WHO ASKED YOU? 

Oh, and to all the self-involved dimwits who write me off as shy based on my unwillingness to have long, chummy conversations with you or even look at you longer than I absolutely have to - let me clarify. I'm not shy. I just silently dislike you and don't think it's conducive to specify my exact feelings on the matter.

Have a nice day, and uh... enjoy those blue thongs.

"Expert textpurt, joking smokers, don't you think the joker laughs at you?..... man you've been a naughty girl - you let your cornhole down"

Zappa zaps ya'........

Kristen and I just finished watching the "Tommy Chronicles". I haven't watched those tapes in years, but I'm writing a book about the shit ( would know) so I had to get some reference. Kristen certainly had a lot to say about the whole thing, as she normally does, and I think it's pretty safe to admit that I've spent the last two hours laughing so hard my stomach hurts. Bless you, Tommy. You're such a good liar. Pot and the kettle. He wastes tape telling me that (and I quote), "If you don't love me forever, I'll destroy the world!" followed by some bullshit about how "boring" some party at Light had been. The party probably bored him because he couldn't get laid - pay no mind to the fact that he had a girlfriend in Denver. It was perfectly acceptable to have sex with other women, just as long as I didn't find out, which I did anyway. He was special like that. I'm thinking about copying the tapes and sending them to every news and cable station, in hopes that someone will play them on TV. What do you guys think? Should I do it and destroy some poor schmuck's life? you're so much fun. Take the quiz: "Find your IQ (pictures)"

Genius IQ 141 and above
Wow. Your IQ is 141 and above. Meaning you are smart as hell. Intelligence probably runs in your family but you are probably very modest about your intelligence and may down play it to feel like you belong. Rock ON Smart Ass!

I had an exhausting conversation with a girl in my audio production class this afternoon.

She argued with me about the concept of frequency.  

I tried to explain the term in it's simplest context - Frequency equates to cycles of sound per second measured in Hertz.  

After almost twenty minutes, she still had no idea what frequency has to do with a sound wave, yet she's taken this class three semesters in a row.

And all this time I was under the impression that CU students were relatively bright.

It would seem that I'm one of the few.

Un relatedly, I caught a little of 'American Idol Las Vegas' this evening and, out of morbid curiosity, decided to sit down and watch.

Once again, my assessment that most residents of Vegas are fucking trash has proved to be correct.

I was absolutely certain of this after seeing an anorexic farm girl, wearing over-sized hot pink glittered vinyl pants with a matching cowboy hat, try and sing an Elvis song.

Her performance was breath taking, and anything that suffocates me can't be a good thing.
If a tree falls in the forest and it springs back upright as a joke, what do the squirrels do?

I have just finished watching the darkest and perhaps most seemingly drug-induced version of 'Peter Pan'.

Tinkerbell, you're a little pistol, arencha?

It's good to know I'm not the only person interested in corrupting the youth.

I also had a "debate" with "Jack the Queer" over whether or not the Parthenon was, in fact, an actual Greek temple.  It all went down in yet another riveting two hours of art class.

"Hey Jack (because I know you're name's not Jacques, as you so gaily claimed), I too thought the Parthenon was simply a painting....oh, wait....nevermind.  I'm thinking of someone else."

According to Jack, he's also related to the Mona Lisa.  His mother told him so.

Fucking idiot.

There are times when choosing to sit at the Paris coffee bar doesn't make for the best decision...

The next person who stops in front of the gelato case and asks, "So...this is cheese?" is going to get a stir stick in the eye.

I mean, really. When have you EVER seen vanilla cheese? Put some thought into it, people.

I met a guy named Tommy in my English class.

I thought he was interesting until he said, "So tell me about your life.  What have you done?"

How the hell does someone go about answering that question?

I couldn't think of anything else to say except, "Oh, I do a little of this, and a little of that.  I write goofy entries in my online journal, when I was younger I got a thrill out of testing the statutory rape laws, and I've got a "bomb pit" theory.  Yes, a "bomb pit" theory."

I'm social like that.

Tommy looked at me for a moment, then asked if he could "get my number".

I told him that I didn't date guys named 'Tommy', then offered to introduce him to my ice pick.

Apparently my tact wasn't up to par because he didn't get my oh-so-obvious hint.  

He said, "I understand.  You're shy."

ME:  That's right, I'm shy.  Would you like to go gun shopping with me?

The moron actually accepted my offer, then said that he'd have to get my number so we could set up a time.

What a winner.

When I see him again, I'm going to ask if I can use him for target practice.

In other news, one of my friends emailed me a picture of Mike Patton masturbating in front of some poor crowd in Canada.

It was the hottest yet most disturbing thing I've ever seen.

http://www.bungletofantomas.com/images/tomahawk%20nov%2019%202001/london%20show%20031002/non%20sensored%20shower.jpg

It was also brought to my attention that I've lost my spark.

$20 and a cupcake to whoever finds it.

I just woke up and I'm fascinated at what half a box of DayQuil can do to your day.  

I'm still not sure what day it is, truth be told.

I sat in my art class this morning high as a kite, possessed by thoughts of awe and admiration over the fact that my body is slowly trying to asphyxiate itself.

The illness is due to my insistence on having "game night" with my girlfriends last night.  We played "Imangin...iff" and I learned that if I were a gift, I'd be a book, and if I were a weapon, I'd be a nuclear bomb.  I was also the only one in the group who knew what "RCA" meant.

Try and quell your surprise there.

Don't get me wrong - these are things I've always secretly wanted to know about myself, but I didn't know that Sandy had to get drunk and sneeze all over me in order for me to do so.

I got her back...  

She brought me chicken noodle soup this afternoon and I fed it to my dog.

Due to the high of the DayQuil, I thought feeding her soup to the doc would be an appropriate form of revenge.

Oh how the mighty have fallen.

I was reading at Tattered Cover this morning and a guy who smelled like he had rolled around in a Porta-Potty plopped himself down right next to me.

Three seconds later he says, "Boy, it smells funny in here...do you smell it? What is that?"

I just smiled at him and tried not to pass out.

Meanwhile, I should be inducted as an honorary saint for not screaming, "YOU, STINKY BITCH, YOU!!!"

I also received a rather interesting piece of mail today that said, "Aspen, I want your dark sex.  Love, ?"

I swear it's from the weird guy that always walks by my house to talk to my dog.

Nonetheless, I must have missed the boat somewhere because I've been living under the assumption that sending psychotic love notes to someone was now illegal.

On a much brighter note, I am now a homeowner.

I have finally taken that extra step to join the rest of the middle-class.

MOM: Twenty-five's almost here!  What do you want for your birthday?

ME: Um......

MOM: And don't say vibrators or weapons.

ME: .....then I don't want anything.

I'm beginning to believe that my family knows me a little too well.

Who gets into arguments about the meaning of 'iambic pentameter'?

I do.  And apparently so does the guy at Paris that just won't seem to leave me alone.

Here's how it played out (because I sense that you're all dying to know):

I'm sitting at the coffee bar, reading the author whose mind I wish I could have fucked before he died (Georges Bataille), and minding my own damn business when this tall lanky motherfucker walks up to me and says:

"I have a good question for you.  My friends and I don't think anyone in the place knows what iambic pentameter is, so I'm asking you.  Do you know what iambic pentameter is?"

I went on to explain its use in poetry and the whole 'verse in the measure of five' thing, but as I spoke, the expression on his face became more and more deranged.

He told me I was wrong and that iambic pentameter was the same thing as a metronome.

I just shook my head and he walked away.  I hate idiots, and I can assure you that he's going into the fucking pit.

And pay no attention to the fact that my life has become an ongoing anecdote.

Or to the man behind the curtain.

And what's with this Bohemian fashion craze?  There is nothing even remotely attractive about paisley.

"HEY!  THE ANGRY PEASANTS CALLED.  THEY WANT THEIR GODDAMN RAGS BACK!"

Some days, I'd be pleasantly delighted to see Leng Tch'e brought back as "fashionably savvy"

Un-relatedly, my favorite Thai restaurant now delivers.

Apparently all of my death threats finally made their way to the home office.

So I had a terribly compelling conversation with a book slave at Barnes & Noble this morning.

ME: Excuse me, I need to order an out of print book.

BS: Um... okay, I suppose I can help you. But I'm gonna to have to stop what I'm doing....

ME: Yes, that's correct.

BS: (Sighs) Okay, author?

ME: James Joyce.

BS: Who?

ME: James Joyce.

BS: I don't know who that is.

ME: Let me try it again - JAMES JOYCE!

BS: Okay I'll put it in, but I don't think that's the name of a real author.

ME:.....

BS: Have you tried Joyce Cameron?

ME: Who the hell is that?

BS: (Laughs) That's my mom.  She wrote a book.

ME: That's very interesting, but I have to admit to you that this conversation doesn't exactly equate to a good time for me....(Stares at her)....JAMES JOYCE!

BS: Let me get someone to help you.

What's even better was the conversation we had when she came back with her manager.

ME: Hey, real quick, do you know who Mapplethorpe is?

BS: (Looking insulted) Uh, yeah, who doesn't? He's, like, one of my favorites.

ME: (Laughs) I'm just kidding - Mapplethorpe is a publishing company. (Walks away)

Fucking idiot.

One more person who should be swallowed in the pit.

My cousin Jonathan called last night wanting sex tips.

All I said was to pay attention to the happy little man in the boat.

He called back this morning.

"Aspen! The little man in the boat JUST WON'T DROWN!!"

I can imagine that it's pretty hard to be a sex god when you're twelve and your mother still dresses you.

As I was walking Draven into his classroom this morning, I was approached by a little nine-year-old who dresses like a princess and looks like Miss. Piggy.

She says, "Hi Miss. Aspen," (putting on her best *I'm an angel* face) "That's a really pretty sweater."

"Well, thank you Lisa," I said.

Just then, the little Indian girl that Dre has a crush on walks by, and little Miss. Piggy starts taunting,
"Draven and Lidea sitting in a tree, k-i-s-s-i-n-g.  First comes love, then comes marriage, then comes baby in the baby carriage!"

Well, normally I wouldn't intervene (after all, kid's disgusting little games are so precious and heartwarming) but on this occasion, Draven was giving me the *please save me from the mockery of this little fat girl* look, so what else could a mother do?

I looked right at her and said, "Sweetie, it's the twenty-first century.  It doesn't really work that way anymore.  Let me explain: first comes the baby, and unless you have an abortion, THEN comes marriage, and if you're lucky, your husband won't beat you up.  If he doesn't, then comes love.  You've got it all backward."

After a brief pause, I smiled.

She just stood there in whatever kind of shock a shitty little nine-year-old can feel.  Still smiling, I told her to be good in school, and walked away.  As we walked, Draven turned around and stuck his tongue out at her.  I don't normally encourage this type of behavior, but to save Draven's boyhood, I figured I should let him get a jab in for good measure.

Don't you wish I was your mother? Mm, well I'm sure you do now.

On a much more pleasant note:  

I was cleaning out Draven's backpack last night and found a half-eaten sandwich that had to be about three months old.

I told him I'd give him twenty bucks if he would lick it.

He avidly refused.

This is what I put up with when I decide to meet my girlfriends for a drink:

And just to let you all know, I'm dubbing the bartender "Skippy" because although he held a striking resemblance to Johnny Depp, he was a moron.

(SKIPPY walks over to our booth and looks at me)

SKIPPY: I saw you from across the room and something told me to come over and talk to you.

ME: Could it be because you're supposed to take my drink order?

SKIPPY:  (Laughs) I bet you were thinking about me, and we're linked in our minds somehow.  THAT'S why I just HAD to come over.

ME: (Sarcastically) Hm, I must have turned my inner monologue on.  Can I get a drink?

SKIPPY: Sure, if I can get your number...

ME:.....

SKIPPY: Um,...no? Oh, you probably don't have a pen, right?  I'll get one for ya', cuz I know you want to give me your number.  I'm hot!

(As he walks away, he trips over a bar stool and hits his head on the corner of a table on the way down)

ME: (Looking concerned) Are you alright?  You need a.... band aid or something?

SKIPPY: (Gets up - has blood trickling from his head) Who put that there?  (Laughs nervously and continues walking away)

It's got to be the most embarrassing thing to ask for a girl's number, then trip and gash your head open right in front of her.  

He came back to our booth fifteen minutes later with a huge gauze bandage wrapped around his head.
  
I tipped him fifty bucks.

At the club last night, Jake was speculating on why it takes women longer to pee than men. No solid evidence was presented but it was still fantastic. I also happen to be absolutely infatuated with 's little quizzes. I now know that I am intelligent enough to live on planet Earth, though I wasn't aware that there was a litmus test for such a thing. Nonetheless...
No RTTS candidacy in your future! Your feet are
firmly planted in the Earth (both figuratively
and literally speaking). You've got a good head
on your shoulders, and you probably found this
quiz amusing. You're very intelligent, and
there's no way in hell that you would ever be
duped into getting on the Rocket to the Sun.
Even if they told you that you would be the
first to colonize Mars, you would likely be
skeptical (after all, it is the Government
feeding you this propaganda). You can, however,
appreciate the value of the Rocket to the Sun
concept. You believe it would be the perfect
way to get rid of all the stupid people while
simultaneously solving the world's population
and resource problems. You'd likely even
volunteer to head up the committee to recruit
people to take a trip on the Rocket to the Sun.
You're a master manipulator who can convince
these people that they really are special
enough to be the first to colonize Mars. Your
life has significant value!

Are you a 'Rocket to the Sun' candidate?
brought to you by Quizilla

Float On by Modest Mouse
"Bad news comes don't you worry even when it lands Good news will work its way to all them plans" Laid back and real, people appreciated you for you are in 2004.
What 2004 Hit Song Are You?

If there are two things I love, it's good coffee and being compared to a terrorist.

If only I lived in France.

Yesterday, I learned that stealing all the Christmas tree ornaments and hiding them in the oven doesn't exactly make for a good response.

Especially when someone tries to auto-clean the oven before looking in it first.

Merry Christmas, suckers!

I'm going to Jamaica.

I'm in love with "Tooth Imprints On A Corn Dog" by Mark Leyner.

I mean, to think I've lived out almost twenty-five years without knowing what really goes on in sub 40 of Bergdorf Goodmans or of the erotic alert bracelet, the Home Shopping Network's special nuclear arms sales, or the social danger of children being exposed to Mary Poppins.

And all the pretentious, obscure words remind me of what Jesty would spew if you gave him a book deal...

My skin tingles just thinking about it.

Oh how Christmas parties can be disturbing, yet so much fun.

It's always a joy to see your friends get shit-faced and strip atop your dining room table.  And the party has only just begun...

I'm raising my glass to all of you in hopes that your holidays will be a delight.

And that you'll all get festively drunk and blow up your friends.

Today I learned that it's extremely difficult to put a fucking corset on by yourself.

The whole thing took some careful planning on my part.  I had the genius idea to buckle the back and then try to slip it over my head.  

It didn't work out too well.

The damn thing got stuck, so I ran around the house for ten minutes looking like a giant, pink and black fruit roll-up until I wiggled my way out of it. 

I also bought a rolling pin today.

I'm referring to it as "My Little Murder Weapon" ....

Try not to think about it.

KRISTEN: You're quiet this morning.  What's on your mind?

ME: Would you ever consider wrapping your entire body in masking tape and pretending you're a giant joint?

KRISTEN: (Laughs) What?!?

ME: Just answer the question and we'll move on.

KRISTEN: (Still laughing) Aspen, you're so weird.

ME: So that's a no then....?

You guys wanna hear something funny?

Me too.  Ya' got anything?  Yeah, neither do I.  However, I bought "training spray" for my dog and he goes nuts every time I spray it, so I tried some to see what all the fuss was about.

It was like a big, festive yeast infection in my mouth.

Needless to say, I won't be doing that again.

So I'm sitting at Paris trying to get my fucking laptop online when some girl, who I'm calling SuperSkank, walks up to me and feels the need to strike up a conversation.

SS: Trying to get online?

ME: It's this damn wireless internet. Some days I just feel inept, ya' know?

SS: Yeah me too, like this morning, I woke up and realized I didn't have any clean undies.

ME: Um...okay...

SS: (Leans into me and whispers) I just turn them inside-out.

ME: .....

SS: Well, good luck with your internet. I'm gonna go try to get that guy's number.

    (She points to a little skater kid sitting across the room then walks away)

ME: Uh.... (Still in shock)

I just starred at her in morbid disbelief that a perfect stranger would walk up to me and reveal that she's wearing dirty underwear inside-out underneath her jeans.  

As I watched the skater kid give her his number, I couldn't help but want to warn him not to take off her pants.  Well, that and I suddenly felt the strong desire to buy the girl some laundry detergent.

I have to stop hanging out in this coffee shop so much.

Fourth book finished, suckers!

How is it that you find yourself with your best friend in an office supply store discussing the erotic possibilities of using a chrome stapler as a sex toy?

I'm supposing this isn't your average Saturday morning conversation.

Enjoy your eggs.

So I took a journey into the wonderful world of porn this afternoon.  

I didn't intend to.  The ad said **Free Popcorn Maker/Automatic Can Opener** 

...so I opened the link, because ...well, you know how we'de all like one of those.

Needless to say I soon found out what they meant by "Can Opener".

Tricky bastards.

I managed to entangle myself in a battle of wits with a Walgreen's clerk named Libby who I swear has downs-syndrome.

LIBBY: Well here's a questions for you. Who was assassinated?

ME:...As in president?

LIBBY: Yes.

ME:...Which one?

LIBBY: JFK

ME: Lincoln

LIBBY: Martin Luther King

ME: Um ...

LIBBY: Ok, here's another one. What is the capital of Wyoming?

She had me stumped. How confident I had been entering this contest only to be shot down by so simple a question. "Wyoming?" I thought, the names of capitals racing through my head. Hours spent during car rides rattling off the capitals and here I was, for once when it mattered, for once when my honor was at stake and I was drawing blanks.

LIBBY: I'll give you a hint. It's not Mississippi.

I looked for help but to ask would admit defeat. Fucking Wyoming. I was losing and losing badly. Boise? No...Idaho...Did Wyoming even have a capital? Did it even have people living in it? 

LIBBY: It's not Mississippi, because that's the capital of Alabama.

Thank God for her manager who happened to waltz up, haphazardly interrupting our silence during which all I could think was that I should drop the cash register on her, leave her for dead, and run for the fucking hills.

Do society a favor, ya' know?
The real question is if Jessica Simpson were a stale hotdog, do you think she would eat herself?
